channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Donald Trump is asking friends how his campaign is performing: 'Unfair that I beat him and now...'
item.description: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald Trump is now complaining relentlessly and grown increasingly upset about Kamala Harris' surging poll numbers and media coverage. According to a Washington Post report, Donald Trump told an ally last week on phone that it's unfair that he beat Joe Biden and now he has to beat Kamala Harris too. Trump is asking his friends how his campaign is performing, the report said.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Stolen valor' row: Tim Walz said he carried weapons; 'When, which war,' JD Vance's counter
item.description: The military record of Kamala Harris' running mate Tim Walz came under scrutiny as his rival JD Vance said if one does not go to the war, then he can't claim that he served in the military. JD Vance said Tim Walz dropped out of the army and took retirement in 2005 before his unit was deployed in Iraq.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Let loose the dogs of war: Ukraine to deploy 'Bad One' along front lines
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Violence must stop: Indian-American Congressmen call for end to violence against Hindus in Bangladesh
item.description: ​​They have also called upon the incoming interim government's prime minister-designate, Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, to uphold the rule of law as he assumes power.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: JD Vance was asked whether he knows what 'Kamabla' means. His reply is....
item.description: Former president and GOP presidential candidate Donald has a new nickname for Kamala Harris 'Kamabla' which made its first appearance on Monday in Trump's Truth Social post. "People cote with their STOMACH, and food is now at an all time high because of Kamabla/Biden INCOMPETENCE. With them in charge, IT WILL ONLY GET WORSE" -- this was the post. And it was not a typo as Kamala was Kamabla since then.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US weekly jobless claims fall more than expected in latest week
Trump will hold a news conference in his first public appearance since rival Harris picked Walz
item.description: Former President Donald Trump announced a press conference at Mar-a-Lago, marking his first public appearance after Kamala Harris became the Democratic presidential nominee with Tim Walz as her running mate. Trump, criticized Harris for not holding a news conference since her campaign launch, indicated his willingness to debate her in the forthcoming presidential debate.

item.title: Trump took a private flight with Project 2025 director in 2022, reveals new photo
item.description: Donald Trump has categorically denied having anything to do with controversial Project 2025 but the controversy is far from dying down as now a photo of Trump with Kevin Roberts, the president of Heritage Foundation has surfaced. Reports said Trump took a 45-minute private flight with Kevin Roberts, which was not reported earlier.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: First murder in 20 years in this town of US is straight out of a horror movie
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: High hopes for change as Bangladeshis welcome new leader Yunus home
item.description: Three days after a student-led uprising forced the autocratic premier to flee, Bangladeshis welcomed Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus as the caretaker government leader. Yunus faces significant challenges, including corruption and law enforcement, but hopes for democracy and stability are high. His international reputation and lack of political entanglements are seen as assets for the country's future.

item.title: China confirms discovering world's first large shallow gas field in disputed South China Sea
item.description: China discovered a major gas field exceeding 100 billion cubic meters in the South China Sea, potentially escalating regional disputes. The Lingshui 36-1 gas field, confirmed by the China National Offshore Oil Corporation, could heighten tensions with nations like the Philippines and Vietnam. This adds to the contentious nature of the resource-rich and strategically significant South China Sea.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'My life's mission': Pelosi vows to keep Donald Trump out of White House
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Taylor Swift's Vienna shows cancelled; Austrian authorities discover chemicals in terror attack suspect's home
item.description: Austria cancels Taylor Swift concerts in Vienna after terror threat, seizes chemicals from suspect home
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Explained: Why are people protesting in the UK? What sparked the outrage?
item.description: A wave of riots erupted across the UK, triggered by a tragic knife attack in Southport, leading to violent anti-immigration demonstrations. Misidentification of the attacker, hailing from Rwandan parents, fueled misinformation and clashes. Both far-right groups and anti-racism protesters took to the streets, resulting in numerous arrests and judicial actions. PM Starmer condemned the unrest.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: UK Supreme Court upholds citizenship revocation for 'IS bride' Shamima Begum
item.description: Shamima Begum, who left London at 15 to join Islamic State in Syria, lost her appeal against the UK government's decision to revoke her British citizenship on national security grounds. The courts ruled that her potential victimization as a trafficking victim did not outweigh national security concerns, leaving her with Bangladeshi citizenship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Australian teacher Tayla Brailey arrested for sexually harassing student
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Tropical storm Debby: Coastal flooding, tornadoes and power outages ravage southern states in US
item.description: Tropical Storm Debby triggered massive rainfall and tornadoes in Georgia and the Carolinas, leading to severe flooding and dam breaches. Emergency services rescued over 75 individuals. The storm impacted regions up to New York and New Jersey, causing significant power outages and water rescues. At least six fatalities were reported across affected areas.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Israel vows to eliminate new Hamas chief; stokes fears of deepening Gaza War
item.description: Israel pledged to remove Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, accused of masterminding the October 7 assault. The Gaza war’s intensity grows with Sinwar’s appointment. Israel is prepared for potential Iranian retaliation following the assassination of Sinwar’s predecessor. Sinwar’s leadership and hardline approach suggests a less likely ceasefire, impacting residents in Israel and Gaza.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'I murdered him really badly': Connecticut man kills father, leaves organs outside body
item.description: Steven James Uricchio, 31, was charged with the brutal murder of his father, Marc Uricchio, in Ridgefield. The town's first murder in over 20 years, it has deeply unsettled the community. Uricchio, who confessed to the crime, is undergoing a competency evaluation and is being held on $1.5 million bail.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Jack Karlson, man behind 'Succulent Chinese Meal' 'Democracy Manifest' viral video dies at 82
item.description: Jack Karlson, famous for the viral 'democracy manifest' clip, passed away at 82 due to prostate cancer. He shot to internet fame after a dramatic 1991 arrest over mistaken identity, which went viral in 2009. His niece, Kim Edwards, had started a GoFundMe for his medical bills prior to his death. A documentary is set for release in 2025.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
